greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of numbers that are congruent to {2, 4} mod 6 between prime(n) and prime(n+1) inclusive.
comment: and so on. This can be generalized to
A001223(n) = 3*k-2 or 3*k or 3*k+2 iff a(n) = k for k >= 2.
link: Robert Israel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
program: (MAGMA) [ #[ k: k in [NthPrime(n)..NthPrime(n+1)] | r eq 2 or r eq 4 where r is k mod 6 ]: n in [1..105] ]; /* _Klaus Brockhaus_, Apr 15 2007 */
xref: Cf. A000040 (primes), A001223 (differences between consecutive primes), A047235 (numbers congruent to {2, 4} mod 6), A002654.
results.author: _Giovanni Teofilatto_, Apr 08 2007
ext: Edited, corrected and extended by _Klaus Brockhaus_, Apr 15 2007
